:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(tweets$favorite_count) #fast way to get histogram
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(tweets, aes(x=favorite_count))+geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)

filtered_data <- tweets %>%
  filter(favorite_count < 100) # thingy called pipe operator, sends data into next step aka filter

ggplot(tweets, aes(x=favorite_count))+geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
favourite_summary <- summarise(tweets,
                           mean_favs = mean(favorite_count),
                           median_favs = median(favorite_count),
                           min_favs = min(favorite_count),
                           max_favs = max(favorite_count),
                           sd_favs = sd(favorite_count),
                           mean_RTs = mean(retweet_count),
                           median_RTs = median(retweet_count),
                           min_RTs = min(retweet_count),
                           max_RTs = max(retweet_count),
                           sd_RTs = sd(favorite_count))

favourite_summary
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 1 × 10
  mean_…¹ media…² min_f…³ max_f…⁴ sd_favs mean_…⁵ media…⁶ min_RTs max_RTs sd_RTs
    <dbl>   <dbl>   <int>   <int>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <int>   <int>  <dbl>
1    29.7       3       0   22935    330.    3.17       0       0    2525   330.
# … with abbreviated variable names ¹​mean_favs, ²​median_favs, ³​min_favs,
#   ⁴​max_favs, ⁵​mean_RTs, ⁶​median_RTs
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(tweets, aes(x = favorite_count)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 25) +
  scale_x_continuous(trans = "pseudo_log", 
                     breaks = c(0, 1, 10, 100, 1000, 10000))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tweet_summary <- tweets %>%
  summarise(mean_favs = mean(favorite_count),
            median_favs = quantile(favorite_count, .5),
            n = n(),
            min_date = min(created_at),
            max_date = max(created_at))

glimpse(tweet_summary)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Rows: 1
Columns: 5
$ mean_favs   <dbl> 29.71732
$ median_favs <dbl> 3
$ n           <int> 28626
$ min_date    <dttm> 2021-10-10 00:10:02
$ max_date    <dttm> 2021-10-12 20:12:27
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
date_from <- tweet_summary$min_date %>% # inline code
  format("%d %B, %Y")
date_to <- tweet_summary$max_date %>% 
  format("%d %B, %Y")
```
:::
